Administration.text:
Type: Cholinesterase inhibitor
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: IV, oral (not FDA-approved)
Common Trade Names:

Adult_Dosing.text:
Reversal of non-depolarizing
neuromuscular blocking agents
:
Initial: 0.03-0.07 mg/kg IV, if no efffect, repeat q1 min up to max total dose of 0.07mg/kg or 5mg
Myasthenia gravis
: 15-375mg PO daily (Not FDA-approved)

Pediatric_Dosing.text: Safety/efficacy not well-established in peds, but generally same weight-based dosing as adults

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C, Fetal risk cannot be ruled out
Lactation risk
: Avoid breastfeeding
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: no adjustment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Mechanical bowel or urinary tract obstruction
Peritonitis

Serious.text:
Bradyarrythmia, Atrioventricular block
Seizure, loss of conciousness

Bradyarrythmia, Atrioventricular block
Seizure, loss of conciousness

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 40-75 min
Metabolism: Hepatic (extensive)
Excretion: Renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Competitive cholinesterase inhibitor→ less breakdown of acetylcholine→ more acetylcholine in synapses

See_Also.text:
Neuromuscular blocking agents
Myasthenia gravis
Pyridostigmine
